text: <@U0UHG4VP1|ry> set the channel purpose: Discussion of Iroha
are there two different fabric?      I through the docker images are build from the "make peer" . I got the download from GitHub few weeks ago.
I uploaded our video from Sibos: <https://vimeo.com/188385841>

attachments.title: Soramitsu Sibos 2016 Demo
attachments.text: Demo video shown at the Hyperledger booth at SIbos 2016, showcasing Soramitsu's KYC service using blockchain technology. We use Hyperledger, especially our contribution, Iroha.
attachments.video_html: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/188385841?autoplay=1" width="400" height="225" frameborder="0" title="Soramitsu Sibos 2016 Demo" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: <@U294C6FDW> I don’t really understand your question about docker...

I like your DEMO video!!!   I'm try to verify   " state may be inconsistent, cannot query"  by  bring down one of my  validating peer.  after the peer comes back up from the outage,  I did a query and it has the old ledger. I can't found any messages in the logs that  indicate  this ledger can be "inconsistent".
BTW every year  I have to get certified  and KYC is part of  requirements.    We require to do DR  as part of being compliance with  government regulation.   Thanks

<@U294C6FDW> There are not two different Hyperledger-fabrics, although there are different projects in Hyperledger that are indubators (such as Sawtooth lake,etc,..).  For Hyperledger-fabric, the docker images did get published as version 0.63 of Hyperledger-fabric.   A lot of people prefer the docker images as it makes it easier for them to install and program chain code.

attachments.title: Hyperledger Eyes Mobile Blockchain Apps With 'Iroha' Project - CoinDesk
attachments.text: A distributed ledger project dubbed Iroha has been accepted for incubation status by the Linux Foundation-led Hyperledger blockchain initiative.
attachments.fallback: CoinDesk: Hyperledger Eyes Mobile Blockchain Apps With 'Iroha' Project - CoinDesk

text: Moeka, a local currency experiment in Aizu, Fukushima, that used Iroha made national news yesterday: <http://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20161103/k10010754741000.html>

attachments.title: 仮想通貨の技術使った地域通貨の実証実験 福島 | NHKニュース
attachments.text: ビットコインに代表されるインターネット上で取り引きされる仮想通貨の技術を使った独自の地域通貨で地方の活性化につなげようという実証実験が、３日…
attachments.fallback: NHKニュース: 仮想通貨の技術使った地域通貨の実証実験 福島 | NHKニュース

text: The app was also ranked #3 in Japan under the category of “events"
could you pls  explain whether iroha is a client for hyperledger or a ledger itself
can we run iroha on embedded devices such as beaglebone
<@U2JD3UMEU> We never tried it. We don’t have a beaglebone, so we want to try it on a raspberry pi first.
Hi, i am trying out iroha but I cannot find much docs on the how to perform transactions or smart contracts
can someone point me to some resources

Hi, i use docker image hyperledger/iroha-build and then start 4 peers with the script run-iroha-build.sh. Then i invoke /account/register (with curl on one peer) to create accounts. It works fine :slightly_smiling_face:. i see propagation on the 3 others peers in logs and    a get on /account?uuid= retrieve the account. After that, i test to stop 2 peers and  if i have understand the 2f+1 algorithm, i was expecting that it will not succeed to achieved the consensus and so fail to register account. But it still works ...I miss the point. Another question, i only see /asset/operation on server side (http_server_with_cappuccino.cpp) but /asset/create route existe in iroha-android project. It is because it is still in development phase for the moment? Thanks you. PS : IROHA architecture looks simple with a nice signed transactions events mechanism. congrats.
Regarding stopping 2 peers and then processing transactions, did you remove the peers from sumeragi.json when running?

Hi, I only "docker stop" 2 peers after running the 4 peers with run-iroha-build.sh , i didn't change sumeragi.json. I add more logs in getNumValidSignatures method of sumeragi consensus. It seams that in the 3 valids signatures found, 2 come from the first peer. i will investigate deeper tomorrow. here logs of the peer4 still alive and the peer1 : <https://github.com/branciard/iroha/commit/67f144261362c0333633b9b3973641ef1d743c2b>     .We see that the peer1 send three requests but only receive one response:OK but register account is done at the end.
Okay, thanks. I understand what is going on now. It is easy to fix

Ok i see why i have the same peer signature twice. In processTransaction method in sumeragi.cpp,  "addSignature" is called two times, ligne 279 then ligne 354. I see that there is still WIP to implement the BChain algorithm ?
Hello, how can I get more information about how smart contract is managed ? thanks
The branch with the beta implementation of smart contracts is: <https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/tree/feature/api-javaexec/smart_contract>
